username.Description: Username of Active Directory domain administrator

password.Description: Plain text password of Active Directory domain administrator

domain.Description: Name of the Active Directory domain

dns.Description: Comma separated list of DNS server IP addresses (IPv4 only) for the Active Directory domain

smbServerName.Description: NetBIOS name of the SMB server. This name will be registered as a computer account in the AD and used to mount volumes

organizationalUnit.Description: The Organizational Unit (OU) within the Windows Active Directory

site.Description: The Active Directory site the service will limit Domain Controller discovery to

backupOperators.Description: Users to be added to the Built-in Backup Operator active directory group. A list of unique usernames without domain specifier

poolId.Description: UUID v4 used to identify the Pool

size.Description: Provisioned size of the pool (in bytes). Allowed values are in 4TiB chunks (value must be multiply of 4398046511104).

serviceLevel.Description: The service level of the file system

creationToken.Description: A unique file path for the volume. Used when creating mount targets

serviceLevel.Description: The service level of the file system

usageThreshold.Description: Maximum storage quota allowed for a file system in bytes. This is a soft quota used for alerting only. Minimum size is 100 GiB. Upper limit is 100TiB. Specified in bytes.

usedBytes.Description: Resource size in bytes, current storage usage for the volume in bytes

protocolTypes.Description: Set of protocol types, default NFSv3, CIFS for SMB protocol

snapshotId.Description: UUID v4 or resource identifier used to identify the Snapshot.

subnetId.Description: The Azure Resource URI for a delegated subnet. Must have the delegation Microsoft.NetApp/volumes

volumeType.Description: What type of volume is this

dataProtection.Description: DataProtection type volumes include an object containing details of the replication

snapshotDirectoryVisible.Description: If enabled (true) the volume will contain a read-only .snapshot directory which provides access to each of the volume's snapshots (default to true).

nfsv3.Description: Allows NFSv3 protocol. Enable only for NFSv3 type volumes

nfsv41.Description: Allows NFSv4.1 protocol. Enable only for NFSv4.1 type volumes

allowedClients.Description: Client ingress specification as comma separated string with IPv4 CIDRs, IPv4 host addresses and host names

mountTargetId.Description: UUID v4 used to identify the MountTarget

fileSystemId.Description: UUID v4 used to identify the MountTarget

startIp.Description: The start of IPv4 address range to use when creating a new mount target

endIp.Description: The end of IPv4 address range to use when creating a new mount target

gateway.Description: The gateway of the IPv4 address range to use when creating a new mount target

netmask.Description: The netmask of the IPv4 address range to use when creating a new mount target

smbServerFqdn.Description: The SMB server's Fully Qualified Domain Name, FQDN

endpointType.Description: Indicates whether the local volume is the source or destination for the Volume Replication

remoteVolumeResourceId.Description: The resource ID of the remote volume.

remoteVolumeRegion.Description: The remote region for the other end of the Volume Replication.

snapshotId.Description: UUID v4 used to identify the Snapshot

created.Description: The creation date of the snapshot
